[Defender Leona (375 RP)](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UrppUqGdsGY) stormed through the doors, her right hand holding her sword, and her left hand holding a small piece of paper.

"Is this true?" She asked outraged, her strong voice showing a hint of sadness and disappointment.

[Freljord Ashe (260 RP)](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X47ik2VsnlU) looked at her. It seemed Leona had found out slightly before it was time. Ashe sighed and replied calmly.

"Yes, it's true. I planned on telling you but..."

"A new support? From the Freljord?" Interrupted Leona, waving the piece of paper with the news and eventually crushing it with her hand in anger.

"Leona... He won't be here for a while, try to relax."

"Relax? You're asking me to relax?!"

"Look... We're going to have a match in a couple of hours. Let's do this: if your performance is outstanding, we'll keep you in the team. Deal?"

Leona and Ashe shook hands and then walked into the fields of justice.

Some hours passed, and eventually, the match began.

One champion was chosen from each team to be a judge for Leona's performance. [Viscero Xin Zhao (487 RP)](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3W4Ox6dq2kI), the Seneschal of Demacia, would represent the blue team, while Nasus (292 RP), the dawg, would represent the purple team.

The match then began.

Each judge grabbed a notepad and a pen, and began writing down their observations.

Leona and Ashe headed to the bottom lane as per usual. It didn't take long for them to encounter their lane opponents.

Kog'Maw (440 RP) and some mysterious champion she had never seen before (487 RP) stood near their own turret.

"Duo ADC lane?" Asked Leona.

Kog'Maw started dancing around in response.

The first minutes of the match went on normally. One team got first blood but it didn't even matter since the bonus gold it now gives is almost negligible.

"We must take the turret now," whispered Leona, "otherwise they'll just keep pushing us."

Ashe nodded. It was true, this was their chance to take it.

The minion wave arrived, and Leona threw her Zenith blade at Quinn. She dashed at her and slammed her face with her shield, stunning her, at the same time as she called her solar flare down upon her enemies.

Quinn tried using her bird form to escape, but Ashe cast her enchanted arrow and froze her in place. With a combination of arrows and slashes, Quinn went down.

Kog'Maw was alone now. The enemies had both user their ultimates, so he had that in his favor.

He began spitting his living artillery at them, Leona and Ashe tried running around, evading the powerful projectiles.

Leona got worried. If the new minion wave arrived, Kog'Maw would be able to survive the push until Quinn revived.

In a moment of desperation, Leona used her Zenith blade again.

"NO!" Yelled Ashe.

Leona dashed at her enemy and began striking him. However, she was now under turret range, so the turret began firing at her, each projectile hurting more and more.

Ashe fired as many arrows at Kog'Maw as she could, and eventually, the Mouth of the Abyss was no more.

Leona rolled away from the turret, surviving with just a sliver of health.

"We did it!" Exclaimed Ashe, as the minions finished bringing down the turret, "we took the turret!"

Out of the corner of her eye, however, she saw some sort of corpse standing up, spewing purple liquid out of every orifice he had.

"LOOK OUT!" Yelled Leona and pushed Ashe out of the way. Ashe flew for a second and fell into the river, splashing water all around.

Kog'Maw's corpse exploded, removing the little health Leona had left.

Ashe was left alone in the lane, three corpses around her: two enemies and her brave support.

The judges took note of Leona's sacrifice, as Ashe shed a single icy tear from her left eye. She then realized that, no matter how many new supports arrive, Leona will always be her favourite.

@galliantX I guess my first tip for a starter would be: learn C or C++ first. Not Java or C#. The reason is that it's much easier to move from C/C++ to Java and C# than viceversa.

I met some Java/C# programmers who still had no idea how pointers worked.

**Programming tips?** Start on something *simple*, and as you get more advanced, it should be a little bit easier, as just basically format and syntax change, and maybe a few functions. **Ex.** Learning Java right now for me is a lot easier because I started on Python

If you can teach, that makes you a teacher, whether you employed as one or not! :D
